ANU.name: Chung Tran
expertise: Macroeconomics Incl. Monetary And Fiscal Theory
ANU.biography: Chung Tran's primary research interests are in the areas of macroeconomics and public economics. Much of his current work is to explore the role and implications of economic policies. Some specific research topics have included; evaluating dynamic general equilibrium effects of social insurance systems including social security and public health insurance; analyzing implications of taxation; and understanding dynamic effects of public debt, fiscal stress and fiscal austerity.

Market Inefficiency, Insurance Mandate and Welfare: US Health Care Reform 2010
publication.source: Review of Economic Dynamics, Vol. 20, pp. 132-159

publication.title: Fiscal Policy as a Temptation Control Device: Savings Subsidy and Social Security

Medical Consumption over the Life-cycle: Facts from a U.S. Medical Expenditure Panel Survey
Trade-offs in Means Tested Pension Design
publication.source: Journal of Economic Dynamics and Control, Vol. 47, pp. 72-93
